name: UpdateProjectDetails
description:
Update a project's fields using its name or ID.

Use this tool to modify specific details of a Vercel project by providing its name or ID. Ideal for updating project configurations or metadata.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the Vercel project to be updated.

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

parameters.name: project_update_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing keys and values to update project fields like build command, framework, and more.

buildCommand.description: The build command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

customerSupportCodeVisibility.description: Specifies whether customer support can see git source for a deployment

devCommand.description: The dev command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

framework.description: The framework that is being used for this project. When `null` is used no framework is selected

gitForkProtection.description: Specifies whether PRs from Git forks should require a team member's authorization before it can be deployed

gitLFS.description: Specifies whether Git LFS is enabled for this project.

installCommand.description: The install command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

name.description: The desired name for the project

outputDirectory.description: The output directory of the project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

previewDeploymentsDisabled.description: Specifies whether preview deployments are disabled for this project.

publicSource.description: Specifies whether the source code and logs of the deployments for this project should be public or not

functionDefaultRegions.description: The regions to deploy Vercel Functions to for this project

functionZeroConfigFailover.description: Specifies whether Zero Config Failover is enabled for this project.

resourceConfig.description: Specifies resource override configuration for the project

rootDirectory.description: The name of a directory or relative path to the source code of your project. When `null` is used it will default to the project root

serverlessFunctionRegion.description: The region to deploy Serverless Functions in this project

serverlessFunctionZeroConfigFailover.description: Specifies whether Zero Config Failover is enabled for this project.

skewProtectionBoundaryAt.description: Deployments created before this absolute datetime have Skew Protection disabled. Value is in milliseconds since epoch to match \"createdAt\" fields.

skewProtectionMaxAge.description: Deployments created before this rolling window have Skew Protection disabled. Value is in seconds to match \"revalidate\" fields.

skipGitConnectDuringLink.description: Opts-out of the message prompting a CLI user to connect a Git repository in `vercel link`.

sourceFilesOutsideRootDirectory.description: Indicates if there are source files outside of the root directory

enablePreviewFeedback.description: Opt-in to preview toolbar on the project level

enableProductionFeedback.description: Opt-in to production toolbar on the project level

enableAffectedProjectsDeployments.description: Opt-in to skip deployments when there are no changes to the root directory and its dependencies

enabled.description: Opt-in to Static IPs for this project

staticIps.description: Manage Static IPs for this project

enabled.description: Whether or not to generate OpenID Connect JSON Web Tokens.

oidcTokenConfig.description: OpenID Connect JSON Web Token generation configuration.

deploymentType.description: Specify if the password will apply to every Deployment Target or just Preview

password.description: The password that will be used to protect Project Deployments

passwordProtection.description: Allows to protect project deployments with a password

deploymentType.description: Specify if the Vercel Authentication (SSO Protection) will apply to every Deployment Target or just Preview

ssoProtection.description: Ensures visitors to your Preview Deployments are logged into Vercel and have a minimum of Viewer access on your team

deploymentType.description: Specify if the Trusted IPs will apply to every Deployment Target or just Preview

value.description: The IP addresses that are allowlisted. Supports IPv4 addresses and CIDR notations. IPv6 is not supported

note.description: An optional note explaining what the IP address or subnet is used for

protectionMode.description: exclusive: ip match is enough to bypass deployment protection (regardless of other settings). additional: ip must match + any other protection should be also provided (password, vercel auth, shareable link, automation bypass header, automation bypass query param)

trustedIps.description: Restricts access to deployments based on the incoming request IP address

value.description: The regex path that should not be protected by Deployment Protection

optionsAllowlist.description: Specify a list of paths that should not be protected by Deployment Protection to enable Cors preflight requests

connectConfigurationId.description: The ID of the Secure Compute network

passive.description: Whether the configuration should be passive, meaning builds will not run there and only passive Serverless Functions will be deployed

buildsEnabled.description: Flag saying if project builds should use Secure Compute

connectConfigurations.description: The list of connections from project environment to Secure Compute network

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the team on whose behalf the request is made.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team on whose behalf the request is made.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the vercel API.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name
